intro: Dichasium parallelogrammum, commonly known as the parallel-leaved dichasium, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, commonly known as the carrot or parsley family. The plant is characterized by its opposite, lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered flowers. It typically grows in moist, shady environments such as woodlands or stream banks. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and ecological studies.
